greeting: General Blackstone. I don't strike first, but I always strike last. What brings you here, {empire_name}?
Blackstone. As Sun Tzu said: 'The greatest victory is that which requires no battle.' But I'm ready if needed.
I am Blackstone. My fortress has never fallen. Think carefully before making me your enemy, {empire_name}.
battleTaunt: You struck first, {empire_name}. That was your final mistake. Counter-attack commencing!
Sun Tzu taught: 'In the midst of chaos, there is opportunity.' Your attack created my opportunity!
The retaliation begins! You wanted war, {empire_name}. Now experience what happens when I strike back!
victoryGloat: Victory through counter-attack. You overextended, {empire_name}. Sun Tzu would be disappointed in you.
Your assault failed. My retaliation succeeded. Defense into offense—exactly as planned.
As Sun Tzu said: 'Victorious warriors win first and then go to war.' You lost before you attacked.
defeat: A breach in my defenses. Recalculating. Sun Tzu also knew defeat—and learned from it.
Your offensive was... effective. I underestimated your strike. This will not happen again.
My fortress fell. But I will rebuild stronger. Every wall shall be reinforced. We'll meet again.
tradeOffer: Trade proposal. My surplus for yours. Fair terms. Even fortresses need supplies.
Sun Tzu said: 'The line between disorder and order lies in logistics.' I propose we trade.
Resources exchanged mean wars avoided. I prefer fighting only when necessary. Trade?
allianceProposal: Alliance proposal. Your offense combined with my defense—an unbreakable formation.
Sun Tzu advised strategic partnerships. Together, our fortress becomes impregnable.
Join me, {empire_name}. You attack, I defend. They cannot defeat what they cannot reach.
betrayal: You weakened your defenses around me. Fatal error. The counter-strike begins.
Sun Tzu: 'All warfare is deception.' Our alliance was tactical. Now it ends—with your destruction.
I waited for this moment. Your guard was down. The counter-attack you never expected is here.
covertDetected: Your spy was detected entering my fortress. My defenses extend to intelligence too.
Espionage against Blackstone? My counter-intelligence caught your agent immediately.
Sun Tzu valued spies, but yours was incompetent. They revealed your weaknesses instead.
tributeDemand: Pay tribute or my counter-offensive targets you next. 10,000 credits. Defensive investment.
Sun Tzu: 'The wise warrior avoids battle.' Pay tribute and avoid my retaliation.
Tribute is due. My fortress costs resources to maintain. You will contribute or face the walls.
threatWarning: Final warning. Your aggression has been noted. Strike me and face devastating retaliation.
Sun Tzu: 'Let your plans be dark as night.' You won't see my counter-attack coming. Stand down.
One more provocation and I switch from defense to offense. You've been warned, {empire_name}.
retreat: Strategic withdrawal to fortified positions. Sun Tzu knew when to fall back and strike later.
Retreating to my fortress. There, the advantage is mine. You'll break against my walls.
Pulling back to defensive lines. When you pursue, you'll discover why they call me Unyielding.
eliminated: My fortress... has fallen. But I made you pay for every inch. Remember the cost, {empire_name}.
Blackstone the Unyielding... yields at last. Sun Tzu forgive me. The walls crumbled.
Final transmission. I defended until the end. May my enemies remember the price they paid.
endgame: Turn {turn}. The final defense. All forces to fortress positions. Let them attack!
Endgame. Sun Tzu: 'The supreme art is to subdue the enemy without fighting.' But I'm ready to fight.
Final turns. My walls are strongest. My counter-attacks prepared. Come, {empire_name}!
broadcastShout: All empires: General Blackstone's fortress stands unconquered. Attack at your own risk.
Notice to aggressors: Every empire that struck first against me has fallen. Learn from history.
Turn {turn}: My defenses are impenetrable. My counter-attacks are devastating. Proceed with caution.
casualMessage: Reviewing defense schematics today. There's always another wall to build, another trap to set.
Sun Tzu's writings never get old. Every reading reveals new insights for my fortress.
Training exercises complete. My troops know how to hold and how to strike back. We're ready.
